required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Couple-Based Treatment for Alcohol Use Disorders and Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Couple-Based Treatment for Alcohol Use Disorders and PTSD

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop and test a couple-based treatment for Veterans with an alcohol use disorder and post-traumatic stress disorder.

primary_outcome.description: Total severity score on the CAPS was used. Higher = worse outcome. Possible range of scores 0-135.

Percentage days of heavy drinking (PDHD) was calculated by dividing the number of days in which the Veteran consumed more than six standard drinks by the total days in the period. Both partners reported upon the Veterans' drinking behaviors. Following common practice in AUD research (e.g., McCrady, Epstein, Cook, Jensen, & Hildebrandt, 2011), we used the highest report of the two regarding PDHD to reduce possible underreporting. Possible range of scores 0-100%. Higher = worse.
Patient self-reported total severity score on the PTSD Checklist - Specific (PCL-S) version. Possible range of scores 17-85. Higher = worse.
Partner-reported total severity score for patient's PTSD symptoms on the PTSD Checklist - Specific (PCL-S) version. Possible range 17-85. Higher = worse.

secondary_outcome.description: Patient-reported total severity score on Beck Depression Inventory - II (BDI-II). Possible range 0-63. Higher = worse.
Patient-reported total score on the Dyadic Adjustment Scale (DAS), which is a measure of couple relationship satisfaction. Possible range = 0 - 151. Higher = worse.
Partner-reported Beck Depression Inventory - II (BDI-II) total severity score. Possible range 0-63. Higher = worse.
Partner-reported total score on the Dyadic Adjustment Scale, which is a measure of couple relationship satisfaction. Possible range 0-151. Higher = worse.

arm_group.description: Couple-Based Treatment for Alcohol Use Disorders and PTSD

intervention.intervention_name: Couple-Based Treatment for Alcohol Use Disorders and PTSD
intervention.description: This intervention includes cognitive-behavioral strategies for helping couples to reduce alcohol use and PTSD, while improving relationship functioning.

overall_official.affiliation: Cincinnati VA Medical Center, Cincinnati, OH

facility.name: Cincinnati VA Medical Center, Cincinnati, OH

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 1 couple was excluded due to discovery that they did not meet eligibility requirements

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Clinician-administered PTSD Scale (CAPS)
outcome.description: Total severity score on the CAPS was used. Higher = worse outcome. Possible range of scores 0-135.
outcome.population: Participants completing both pre- and post-treatment assessments were analyzed.

group.title: Arm 1: CTAP
group.description: Couple-Based Treatment for Alcohol Use Disorders and PTSD: This intervention includes cognitive-behavioral strategies for helping couples to reduce alcohol use and PTSD, while improving relationship functioning.

measure.title: Clinician-administered PTSD Scale (CAPS)
measure.description: Total severity score on the CAPS was used. Higher = worse outcome. Possible range of scores 0-135.
measure.population: Participants completing both pre- and post-treatment assessments were analyzed.

outcome.title: Percentage Days of Heavy Drinking
outcome.description: Percentage days of heavy drinking (PDHD) was calculated by dividing the number of days in which the Veteran consumed more than six standard drinks by the total days in the period. Both partners reported upon the Veterans’ drinking behaviors. Following common practice in AUD research (e.g., McCrady, Epstein, Cook, Jensen, & Hildebrandt, 2011), we used the highest report of the two regarding PDHD to reduce possible underreporting. Possible range of scores 0-100%. Higher = worse.
outcome.population: Participants completing pre- and post-treatment assessments were analyzed

group.title: Arm 1: CTAP
group.description: Couple-Based Treatment for Alcohol Use Disorders and PTSD: This intervention includes cognitive-behavioral strategies for helping couples to reduce alcohol use and PTSD, while improving relationship functioning.

measure.title: Percentage Days of Heavy Drinking
measure.description: Percentage days of heavy drinking (PDHD) was calculated by dividing the number of days in which the Veteran consumed more than six standard drinks by the total days in the period. Both partners reported upon the Veterans’ drinking behaviors. Following common practice in AUD research (e.g., McCrady, Epstein, Cook, Jensen, & Hildebrandt, 2011), we used the highest report of the two regarding PDHD to reduce possible underreporting. Possible range of scores 0-100%. Higher = worse.
measure.population: Participants completing pre- and post-treatment assessments were analyzed
measure.units: percentage of days of heavy drinking

analysis.groups_desc: Paired sample t-tests were used. Due to variable skewness, variables were logarithm-transformed to improve their distributions.

outcome.title: Patient-reported Beck Depression Inventory - II (BDI-II)
outcome.description: Patient-reported total severity score on Beck Depression Inventory - II (BDI-II). Possible range 0-63. Higher = worse.
outcome.population: Participants completing the BDI-II at pre- and post-treatment were analyzed

reported_events.time_frame: During duration of treatment and through post-treatment assessment (~20 weeks)

group.title: Arm 1: CTAP
group.description: Couple-Based Treatment for Alcohol Use Disorders and PTSD: This intervention includes cognitive-behavioral strategies for helping couples to reduce alcohol use and PTSD, while improving relationship functioning.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Study was an initial open-trial pilot study. A causal relationship cannot be determined between study interventions and outcomes due to lack of a comparison condition.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Jeremiah A. Schumm, PhD, Associate Director
point_of_contact.organization: Trauma Recovery Center, Cincinnati VA Medical Center
